content.description: The content of the contact flow.

description.description: The description of the contact flow.

name.description: The name of the contact flow.

type.description: The type of the contact flow.

chat_channel.description: Enable chat channels agents can handle in the CCP.

chat_channel_concurrency.description: The number of contacts an agent can have on a channel simultaneously.

default_outbound_queue_name.description: The default outbound queue for the routing profile.

description.description: The description of the routing profile.

name.description: The name of the routing profile.

voice_channel.description: Enable voice channels agents can handle in the CCP.

chat_channel.description: Enable chat channels for the queue.

delay.description: The delay, in seconds, a contact should be in the queue before they are routed to an available agent.

priority.description: The order in which contacts are to be handled for the queue.

voice_channel.description: Enable voice channels for the queue.

block.description: Contains information about the queue and channel for which priority and delay can be set.

directory_user_id.description: The identifier of the user account in the directory used for identity management. If Amazon Connect cannot access the directory, you can specify this identifier to authenticate users. If you include the identifier, we assume that Amazon Connect cannot access the directory. Otherwise, the identity information is used to authenticate users from your directory

hierarchy_group_id.description: The identifier of the hierarchy group for the user

identity_info.description: Contains information about the identity of a user

phone_config.description: The phone settings for the user

routing_profile_id.description: The identifier of the routing profile for the user

security_profile_ids.description: The identifier of the security profile for the user
